plants.name: Delphinium elatum
plants.description: Delphiniums are tall, striking perennials with spiked flower clusters that attract hummingbirds and bees. They thrive in cooler summer climates and are popular in garden borders.
plants.location: Temperate regions of Northern Hemisphere, including Europe and North America
plants.funFact: Delphinium flowers are rich in alkaloids and have historically been used as a natural insecticide.

plants.name: Rhododendron ponticum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub with large clusters of fragrant bell-shaped flowers. It blooms profusely in late spring and early summer in woodland and hillside areas.
plants.location: Native to the Iberian Peninsula and Western Asia, naturalized in UK and other parts of Europe
plants.funFact: This species can form dense thickets that significantly alter local ecosystems when invasive.

plants.name: Wisteria sinensis
plants.description: A vigorous climbing vine known for its cascading racemes of fragrant flowers that create spectacular displays in late spring.
plants.location: Native to China, widely cultivated in gardens in temperate regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Wisteria blooms profusely but can take several years after planting to flower for the first time.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: An evergreen shrub or small tree popular in warm climates, producing abundant clusters of fragrant flowers throughout late spring and summer.
plants.location: Mediterranean, Southern California, and other subtropical to tropical zones
plants.funFact: Despite its beauty, all parts of oleander are toxic if ingested, containing cardiac glycosides.
